dt-api.name: column().order()
dt-api.summary: Order the table by the selected column.

type.description: Determine if the table is being ordered by this column.
type.returns: DataTables API instance containing `-string asc`, `-string desc` or an empty string (indicating index data order) for the possible ordering applied to a column. If a column is not being ordered on, `null` is given.

type.description: Order the table, in the direction specified, by the column selected by the `-api column()` selector.
type.parameter: Direction of sort to apply to the selected column - `dt-string desc` (descending) or `dt-string asc` (ascending).

dt-api.description:
This method provides a useful alternative to the `-api order()` method, allowing you to select the column that you want to be ordered using the flexible `-api column()` selector and having it ordered in the direction specified. As of v2 it also allows you to obtain ordering information about the selected column - determining if it is used in the current order of the table and what ordering direction.
Note that if the selector used for `-api column()` matches more than one column, the result will be truncated to a single column. To perform multi-column ordering, please use `-api columns().order()` or `-api order()`.
Please be aware that when used as a setter, this method sets the ordering to apply to the table - it does not actually perform the order. To have the ordering performed, use the `-api draw()` method, which can be called simply as a chained method of the `-api order()` method's returned object - for example `table.order([0, 'desc']).draw();`.
